scenario_text.value: All right, today we’re going in!

I’m all good to go too! Tied my shoelaces and
everything!
I am totally pumped! Oh, but I almost forgot...

Is it cool if I bring a banana or something?
Are we allowed to have snacks?

What are you blabbering about? Don’t be such
a brat.
I thought we could use some comic relief!

(It kind of feels like we’re going on a field
trip, but I guess that’s unavoidable.)

(It’s not like they taught us in school how
to prepare an assault on an enemy position.)

Remember, we’re not going in there looking
for a fight.

All we’re after is information on how we can
get back to our world.

Still, it seems pretty unlikely that
Garurumon or Archnemon...

...will tell us everything we need to know if
we just say please.

Right. We’re going to have to corner them and
make them talk.

Can we try and keep this as peaceful as
possible?

I mean, if they’re willing to talk
peacefully, sure.

But something tells me we’re gonna have to
twist their noses first.

It may come to that, but don’t forget the
most important thing.
What’s the most important thing?
Know your limits.
Stay focused.
Keep up your resolve.
We all need to remember our limits.

After all, the whole point of this is to get
everyone home safe.

You’re right. Let’s all be careful and try
not to overdo it.
We need to stay focused on our goal.

We can’t let ourselves get distracted or
carried away. No matter what.
Yeah, yeah, I got it already.
We need to keep up our resolve.

Our enemies need to know that we will not
break, no matter what.

Yeah, what Takuma said. That’s sure to put us
at an advantage.

We might not know anything about the ruler of
this world that Jijimon told us about...

...or even if a god-like being like that
really exists.
But we still have to go. It’s our only hope.

Yes, you’re right. Our only option is to keep
moving forward.

Exactly. We’ll be heading out soon. Make sure
you don’t forget anything!
